title: Servotech Power Systems files patents for energy management technologies
contents:
Servotech Power Systems, an EV charging and solar solutions manufacturer, has announced that it has filed two patents for innovative energy management technologies that facilitate grid service optimization through a battery energy storage system (BESS) and effectively channel renewable energy into BESS for maximum value, respectively, enabling the transition to sustainable energy.
The first patent relates to a system and method that enables third-party entities to control load shifting in a BESS. The technology allows third-party entities, such as utilities or aggregators, to optimize using BESS assets to provide grid services.
The second patent relates to a system and method for effectively channeling energy from a renewable energy source, such as solar or wind, into a BESS. The technology optimizes the use of renewable energy by ensuring that it is stored in the BESS when it is most valuable.
Servotech stated that both technologies are applicable across a broad spectrum of fields, including solar and electric vehicle charging systems.

author: UMA GUPTA
title: Oriana Power secures 16.83 MWp of solar projects under RESCO segment, Torrent to develop 3.7 MW PV plant for Benzo Chem
contents:
Noida-based Oriana Power announced today that three of its arms, TrueRe SPV, OPPL Guj SPV, and Solarithic Power, have secured new solar projects of 16.831 MWp capacity under the company’s RESCO (Renewable Energy Service Company) segment. Earlier this month, the company bagged RESCO-mode solar orders aggregating to 7.409 MWp. With these additional orders, Oriana Power’s total aggregate capacity will increase by 24.24 MWp.
The projects are scheduled to be completed in the financial year 2023–24.
Torrent Power will set up a 3.7 MW solar plant for power supply under open access to the production units of Benzo Chem. It will execute the project through a special-purpose vehicle, TU10, with a minimum of 26% equity owned by Benzo Chem. 
NTPC has tendered the land and EHV transmission system package to develop up to 1 GW of interstate transmission system-connected solar PV projects in the Bhuj Region of Gujarat.

author: UMA GUPTA
title: Loom Solar unveils 16BB bifacial TOPCon module
contents:
Loom Solar, an emerging solar technology start-up in India, has launched a bifacial TOPCon pv panel that provides a peak power output of 575 W with a power conversion efficiency of up to 22.3%. The rear side gain is up to 25%, leading to 700W output.
The module is built with 144 half-cut solar cells and 16 busbars. It measures 2,278×1,134 mm. The frame thickness is 1.5 mm.
Loom Solar is also offering small category polycrystalline solar modules of 10 Wp to 44 Wp, 55 Wp mono PERC, 225 Wp mono PERC built with half-cut cells, and 550 Wp mono PERC.

title: Genus Power wins smart metering order worth INR 3,121.42 crore
contents:
Genus Power Infrastructures announced today its arm has received a Letter of Award worth INR 3,121.42 crore for providing advanced metering infrastructure services.
The scope includes designing an advance metering infrastructure (AMI) system with supply, installation, commissioning, and facility management service of 36.27 lakhs smart prepaid meters and system meters, including DT Meters with corresponding energy accounting.
Genus Power Infrastructures secured the project under the Reforms-Based, Result-Linked Power Distribution Sector Scheme. The project is to be executed on a design-build-finance-own-operate transfer basis.
With this addition, Genus Power Infrastructures’ total order book is now over INR 17,000 crore.
The Government of India has launched the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme to improve the power distribution sector’s operational efficiency and financial sustainability. One of the key objectives of the scheme is to install 250 million smart meters across India.

author: VINCENT SHAW
title: China’s Sunrev plans 20 GW solar cell, module factory
contents:
Sunrev Group says it has signed an agreement with the administration of Xining, Qinghai province, to construct an integrated solar cell and module manufacturing facility. The company will invest CNY 40 billion ($5.56 billion) in the new factory, which will feature a 40 GW wafer capacity and 20 GW capacity for both cells and modules. The project is expected to generate 12,000 jobs and a GDP output of CNY 38 billion annually.
GCL Technology, a PV polysilicon and wafer manufacturer, has reported unaudited profits of CNY 921 million for the first nine months of the year. It produced 53,607 tons of granular silicon, shipped 67,607 tons (including 3,611 tons used internally), and manufactured 15 GW of wafers, with 7 GW destined for an unspecified OEM. Sales included 15 GW, of which 6 GW were OEM wafers.
Datang Group, a Chinese property development company, has launched its 2023-24 solar module procurement tender, aiming to secure 5 GW of n-type panel products. The bidding submission deadline is Nov. 7.
